2. Next, consider two cases based on the definition of absolute value.
Case 1: When n + 6 is nonnegative (n + 6 ≥ 0, which means n ≥ -6)
• Check conditions: -2 is both ≤ 2 and ≥ -6, so n = -2 is valid.
Case 2: When n + 6 is negative (n + 6 < 0, which means n < -6)
• This is a contradiction, so there are no solutions in this case.
